content: sea lace top september 2015 features top-down seamless in-the-round construction round yoke with wide scoop neckline cap sleeves waist and hip shaping included skill level intermediate size and gauge small finished bust about 33 two base pattern repetitions patt reps = 5 1/2 notes there are 12 base patt reps at the bustline thus you can change the finished bust measurement by changing your gauge to meet base patt repeat = desired bust /12 lace pattern is stretchy and can be worn with quite a bit of negative ease yarn and hook about 600-800 yards of fingering to sport weight yarn size g 4 0 mm hook or hook required to meet desired gauge note top can be made in a variety of yarn weights from fingering to dk just make sure to pick a hook/yarn combination that produces your required gauge as well as a fabric that you like garment notes garment is worked top-down in joined rounds right side always facing garment is constructed of a total of 20 reps 6 for each of front and back and 4 for each sleeve stitch notes this top is built around the sea stitch lace pattern shown below we ll call this the base pattern and use its patt repeat to determine gauge gauge swatch chain a multiple of 12 plus 3 turning chains row 1 chain 3 3cl * chain 1 treble_crochet in next chain twice chain 1 and v in next st chain 1 treble_crochet in next chain twice chain 1 and 7cl repeat from * across ending with 4cl over last 4 st chain 3 turn row 2 double_crochet in next st counts as 2cl *double_crochet in next 11 st skcl repeat from * across to last 2 st 2cl over last 2 st chain 3 turn row 3 3cl * chain 1 treble_crochet in next chain twice chain 1 and v in next st chain 1 treble_crochet in next chain twice chain 1 and 7cl repeat from * across ending with 4cl over last 4 st chain 3 turn repeat row 2 and 3 for pattern sea stitch diagram base pattern abbreviations used chain chain st stitch slip_stitch slip_stitch skip skip fsc foundation single_crochet single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet treble_crochet triple crochet v treble_crochet chain 1 treble_crochet in same stitch xcl x-cluster double_crochet x decrease over the next x stitches ie 3cl = double_crochet 3 decrease over the next 3 stitches skcl skip-cluster over 3 st double_crochet 2 decrease over 1st and 3rd st skipping the 2nd st m marker patt repeat pattern repetition instructions chain or fsc 120 join with slip_stitch being careful not to twist yoke see stitch diagram next page round 1 chain 3 2cl counts as initial 3cl *treble_crochet chain 1 v chain 1 treble_crochet 3cl repeat from * around slip_stitch to top of 2cl round 2 chain 3 double_crochet in each st around slip_stitch to chain 3 round 3 chain 3 2cl counts as initial 3cl *chain 1
